meanings.definition: To set or thrust in motion.
meanings.sent1: She will launch the boat into the water.
meanings.sent2: They will launch the new product next week.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to launch itself from tree to tree but kept missing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter launched a wave of joy among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The rocket will launch into space with a powerful force.

meanings.sent1: He will launch his speech with a joke to grab the audience's attention.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to launch a new advertising campaign.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to launch a rabbit out of his hat but found a carrot instead.
meanings.sent4: Her smile launched a thousand conversations at the party.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will launch the lesson with an interesting story.

meanings.sent1: The ship will launch fireworks into the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The zoo will launch a conservation program for endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally launched a tomato across the kitchen while chopping.
meanings.sent4: His words launched a series of misunderstandings among the group.
meanings.sent5: The singer will launch her new album at the concert next month.
